subject: Ethics
title: Toxic Leadership
description: A fast breakdown of Toxic Leadership for builders.

hook.text: A CEO screamed at employees daily. Revenue was up 40%. The board called him 'passionate.' Turnover was 70%.

buildup.text: Toxic leaders use fear, humiliation, and manipulation. They deliver short-term results at long-term human cost.

discovery.text: Research shows toxic leadership costs US companies $24 billion annually in turnover, lawsuits, and lost productivity.

twist.text: Boards tolerate toxic leaders when profits are high. The damage only surfaces after the leader leavesâ€”or gets sued.

climax.text: Uber's Travis Kalanick drove explosive growth and a culture so toxic it nearly destroyed the company.

punchline.text: A leader who breaks people to hit numbers isn't leading. They're looting.

quiz.question: Why do boards often tolerate toxic leaders?
options: Toxic behavior always improves company culture
They deliver short-term financial results that mask long-term damage
Employees actually prefer aggressive leadership styles
